title: Why is it that there has to be bots in normals?
body: I play norms most of the time because my friends play it. But whenever I play with them we usually always have a bot in our team. It is retarded because the bot ints every time and we can't win because one of their players got fed by bot. Can Rito games please remove bots out of pvp games

replies.body: I disagree with you can't win - but RIOT - you need to sort out 1) the balance - they ruin games & 2) improve their play!!
To be clear, these aren't Riot bots like you vs in Co-op vs AI that OP is talking about. They're talking about player bots, which are against the ToS and get banned in waves.

those ARE  the bots I'm talking about (you expect the Co-op vs AI bots to be dumb) -  the prevalence of bots in normal games is making game play awful - they just feed, the balance on the teams doesn't work (I played a game with 3 bots on our side vs 0 on theirs) - when their starting items is boots (besides the 'heal', 'haste' summoners), you get a clue to how well your game is going to go - OH, and they'll never ff, so if you have 2 on your side, you're playing to the bitter end â€¦.


If they were smarter (played more like humans?), didn't just feed, it'd make for a better game - but they don't & frankly, while it is shortening queue times, it is at the detriment of the gaming experience.

Those bots aren't made by Riot, they're made by players selling the accounts. Riot have no control over how well they play, they can only remove them. They aren't there to shorten queue times, they're there because players try to *illegally* make some money. Botting isn't something that Riot allows.

The reason they aren't banned instantly is because they are banned in waves to obfuscate what exact behaviours are being detected. The reason there will always be bots is because creating a new account is easy, free and very accessible. The most Riot can do is make it as unprofitable as possible.
Hmmm - maybe Riot needs to add the 'it's a bot' alongside 'intentional feeding' - this latest wave is getting way to prevalent
The 'Cheating' category is used to report bots (among other things).
